result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony C Stephenson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to pay applicable costs, surcharges and assessments; and provide a DNA sample and pay surcharge. To be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision in case 13CF4366. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Authorized to be served in Wisconsin State Prison. Credit for 70 days time served.
Consecutive to: to case 13CF4366
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting and Child sex offender working with children.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Anthony C Stephenson in court with attorney Danielle L Shelton.  Defendant Anthony C Stephenson in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statements made as to sentencing.  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE to 13CF4366, with credit for 70 DAYS time served--authorized to be served in WSP
The Court ordered the defendant to pay applicable costs, surcharges and assessments be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision in case 13CF4366.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment
The Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample pay surcharge through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision in case 13CF4366.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting and Child sex offender working with children.
Filed,
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  kmw

Defendant Anthony C Stephenson in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Anthony C Stephenson in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Count 2:  Dismissed and read-in
Count 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court orders presentence investigation and defendant REMANDED.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  kmw

Defendant Anthony C Stephenson in court with attorney Danielle L Shelton.  James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 4, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with LARRY H. AND JACQUELINE L.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Anthony C Stephenson in court with attorney Louis E Epps.  Defendant Anthony C Stephenson in custody.  Nathaniel E. Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge YAMAHIRO, Branch 34.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
